ACSA-Pre Climbing Checklist
Initiate safety precautions as deemed necessary for the particular project. Barricade around the perimeter of the core at slab level to restrict anyone entering the zone directly under the Jumpform.
Ensure all Z bar holes have been patched prior to the jumpform climb
Visual inspection and sign off by Jumpform Supervisor
Signed off by BKH & Builder
Inspect guide posts connections are as per drawing and free of obstacles to climb
Signed off by BKH & Builder
Ensure all the A-frames are rolled back and secured to jump
Remove all Bar Ties (through wall and at external corner)
Open all Internal and External Rolling Forms
Remove all wall penetration forms/frames
Screen off to provide personnel protection
Clean all working decks of concrete slurry and general debris
Remove excess materials, reinforcement etc from the Jumpform System
Prepare jacks for climbing. Ensure jack feet and plates are centred on wall.
Ensure that the fixed shutters located adjacent to the jacking points are clear of the jacks.
Notify BKH Site Foreman when climbing of the system will take place and the expected duration
Ensure concrete has obtained required project minimum design strength.
Requirement MPA
Coordinate the timing of climb with plumbing and electrical contractors
Inspect electrical and plumbing connections to the Jumpform System and ensure that there is sufficient slack in the cables / pipes to be taken up during climbing
Secure any chains or slings that are attached to the Jumpform System for material handling purposes

Inspect the entire Jumpform System including all trailing decks ensuring that nothing has been inadvertently tied to the core such as electrical leads or chain-blocks. Check that there are no reinforcing bars that foul with the bottom of the jack
Move plywood strip away from core walls at the lower deck level and at all trailing decks prior to the climb
During lifting. Provide one spotter on lower external deck, one in each cell, and one on the top deck, (excluding operator) and one spotter under jump to keep other personnel clear of area
Secure and restrict all access to the Jumpform System during climbing. Limit the personnel on the system to form workers and their supervisor. Prepare ladders for post jump
Radio check
Check forecast wind speed
Ensure Exit ladders are installed prior to commencing climb
Climb system once client site management has been notified.
Has jack been prepared to lift - unplugging cable and ensuring the area around the jacks are free from loose materials
Check that the chain has a valid tag.
Prior to cutting into the top deck ply - Has the area below been inspected for any services
HOLD POINT - if any services consult with contractor to get the services moved prior to cutting into ply

Pre-Climbing Checklist
BKH Checks
Initiate safety precautions as deemed necessary for the particular project. Barricade around the perimeter of the core at slab level to restrict anyone entering the zone directly under the Jumpform.
Confirm that temporary steelwork required for climb is installed as per ACSA drawings
***HOLD POINT*** - Visual Inspection and sign off by Jumpform Supervisor
Remove all Bar Ties (through wall and at external corner).
Check all perimeter doorways to ensure that props are bolted and there are no gaps in mesh
Open all Internal and External Rolling Forms.
Remove all wall penetration forms/ frames. Screen off to provide personnel protection.
Clean all working decks of concrete slurry and general debris.
Remove excess materials, reinforcement, etc from the Jumpform System.
Prepare jacks for climbing. Ensure jack feet and plates are centred on wall. If jack need to be moved Refer to BKH - Moving Jack Checklist below
Ensure that the fixed shutters located adjacent to the jacking points are clear of the jacks.
Notify BKH Site Foreman when climbing of the system will take place and the expected duration.
Ensure concrete has obtained required project minimum design strength. Project requirement is for: 17MPA
Coordinate the timing of climb with plumbing and electrical contractors.
Ensure no jumpform components are tied to any external structures
Secure any chains or slings that are attached to the Jumpform System for material handling purposes.

Inspect the entire Jumpform System including all trailing decks ensuring that nothing has been inadvertently tied to the core such as electrical leads or chain-blocks. Check that there are no reinforcement bars that foul with the bottom of the jack.
Move plywood strip away from core walls at the lower deck level and at all trailing decks prior to the climb.
During lifting. Provide one spotter on lower external deck, one in each cell, and one on the top deck, (excluding operator) and one spotter under jump to keep other personnel clear of area.
Secure and restrict all access to the Jumpform System during climbing. Limit the personnel on the system to form workers and their supervisor. Prepare ladders for post jump.
Radio Check.
Check forecasted wind speeds and weather conditions.
Ensure Exit ladders are installed prior to commencing climb.
Client Check
Confirm minimum concrete strength has been achieved for climb (17 mpa to complete climb)
Check concrete line disconnected (if applicable)
Check site power cabling and plumbing is extended or free to allow jumpform to climb
Check Alimak is prepared for climb - i.e. mast extensions in place, cables not restricted, gates and structure clear
Check access in place for crane operators for after climb. Alert crane crew to climb in progress.
Confirm that lift contractor are not working within the lift shaft before proceeding
Climb system once above complete and site management has been notified.
Pre-Climbing Declaration
Pre-Climbing Sign Off
BKH Moving Jack
Has jack been prepared to lift - unplugging cable and ensuring the area around the jacks are free from loose materials
Check that the chain has a valid tag.

Prior to cutting into the top deck - Has the area below been inspected for any services - HOLD POINT - If any services consult with Head Contractor to get the services moved or isolated prior to cutting.
BKH Jump Form Supervisor & Jumpform General Foreman/Site Manager

Details

The following Agenda Topics shall be covered as a minimum

Any further Safety/Environmental information to be addressed (see below)
Meeting Details
Attach all relevant photos and documents
Site Specific Daily Tasks
Edge Protections
2m or more fall from height, stay back 3m from leading edges and install edge protection.
Handrail maximum 2.4m apart spacing with top, mid rails and toe board.
Screw on handrails must be used. Post to be braced to withstand the weight of a person body.
Catch deck, Working on planks
2m or more fall from height use catch deck. Always stay behind physical edge protection.
Install from below to avoid working at height. Install bearer, timber, plywood and WEXDECK pans from below.
Min 2 planks to be used. Not to walk on timber joists.
Plants and overhead crane
Stay away from trucks and moving plants such forklifts, scissor lifts.
Move away during crane loading and unloading materials near you.
Inclement weather
Dewater any surface water, concrete slurry and moisture on access way and work area prior to start working.
Hot weather, stay in shade and drink plenty water to avoid dehydration.
Not to work/walk in area with surface water.
Stair Access/Access
Ladder for access purpose and not to work from ladder. Use platform ladder to work.

Ladder must be in good condition, 1m min extension above top support, 1 to 4 rule compliance, secured top and button supports, edge protection around top access point, located on solid stable foundation and minimum 3 of your legs and hands must be in contact with ladder during ascending and climbing.
Explosive Powered Tools/ Ramset Gun
Only ticketed and competent person is allowed to use. Display appropriate signage
High velocity direct action explosive powered tool is not allowed and use only tools provided by BKH.

Follow procedure of use, which are from training, such as to check base materials is solid concrete (not polystyrene covered in a thin layer of concrete), type of charger required for fasten materials, warning others prior to firing and no one in the firing line, to load pins just prior to intended to use, misfired procedure, disposal of discharged chargers, keeping in a safe storage after use.
Compressed air

Do not point blow pie to anyone and not to blow in the directions people. Use only when the area is vacant or end of their shift wearing appropriate PPE such as dust mask, eye protections and ear protections. Use alternative methods such as using vacuum, pick up manually or with a picker.
Manual handling
Use mechanical aid, team lifting to 20kg or over.
Handle manually to less than 20kg with straight back, lift with knees, object close to body.
Accident, incident and injury
To report immediately to supervisor.

Screens Pre-Climbing Checklist
Exclusion zone permit to be setup prior to jump.
Platforms & rails clean & clear of all material & debris
Area outside handrail and along slab edge is clean and cleared of all loose material and debris inclusive of halfen cast ins (by others - LLB to check)
Inspect concrete soffit above lowest platform is clear of any loose debris fillets, dags etc
Flaps, infills, rubber covers, are disengaged.
All decks are assessed ready for lifting to commence.
Spotters required on each floor - leading / trailing / intermediate / exclusions
Spotters to have radio communication on each level.
Check power to hydraulic pumps, ensure all lines are laid properly and will not ping or shear during climb (Peri screens only)
Test hydraulic functions by completing a stroke, ensure rams are tested and climbed in pairs (Peri screens only)
Spill kit readily available
Back-propping in place as required. Any props inside PEZ zones on the lowest level are to be bolted.
Area 3m back from leading edge on all levels to be cleared prior to opening any gaps in screen platforms and excluded.
Ensure handrail / fall prevention on all levels where screens are to be climbed – work right complete including mesh & kickboards.
Check all non-typical locations at interfaces with walls/columns, platforms etc
Ensure perimeter containment netting is installed at lowest screen level with the cantilevered catch fan positioned no more than two levels below and extended out (by others – LLB to c
Concrete strength achieved (provided by Lend Lease) *15 MPa required
Signed off by BKH & Builder
If lifting in Alimak/Hoist zone, ensure operation is ceased while lifting
Signed off by BKH & Builder
Inclement Weather: Ensure weather conditions are approved for Tower Crane use. Wind speed not to exceed the approved level on screen shop drawings

Exclusion zones (physical barricades) and signage ‘Danger - No unauthorized access’ or similar in place at all relevant levels, leading/intermediate/trailing/below to ensure no unauthorized access or fall potential by other trades.
Signed off by BKH & Builder

Welding Area Minimum PPE Requirements: Long sleeve high vis shirt, long trousers, steel toe boots
